ADMINISTRATOR OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY

SUMMARY

Advanced Desktop Support Lead/Manager with 14 plus years of experience in the Information Technology field providing Tier II - III technical support.
I have demonstrated highly advanced troubleshooting techniques in resolving end-user issues with swift efficiency and going above and beyond SLA. 15 plus years of experience working with United Senate end-users across multiple technological platforms.

Establishes system by planning and executing the selection, installation, configuration, and testing of PC and server hardware, software, LAN and WAN networks, and operating and system management systems; defining system and operational policies and procedures.

Secures system by developing system access, monitoring, control, and evaluation; establishing and testing disaster recovery policies and procedures; completing back-ups; maintaining documentation.
Prepares users by designing and conducting training programs; providing references and support.
Upgrades system by conferring with vendors and services; developing, testing, evaluating, and installing enhancements and new software.
Meets financial requirements by submitting information for budgets; monitoring expenses for the entire Leadership conference.
Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Information Systems Manager

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Job Title: Information Systems ManagerDepartment: Information SystemsReports to: Corporate SecretaryClassification: Full-time, Exempt
SUMMARY:The IT Manager is responsible for coordinating, planning, and leading computer related activities in an organization. This position determines the IT needs of an organization and is responsible for implementing computer systems to fulfill the organization's information systems requirements. This position will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of critical business applications, with a specific focus on SAP (or other equivalent ERP experiences).
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Manage all information technology and computer systems.Plan, organize, control, and evaluate IT and electronic data operations.Design, develop, implement, and coordinate systems, policies, and procedures.Ensure security of data, network access and backup systems.Coordinate with other Global IT teams (Mainly teams in Japan and in Germany) and team members.Research and evaluate emerging technologies, hardware, and software.Track and maintain hardware and software inventory.Assist with Financial/IT audit as necessary.Set performance goals and conduct regular performance evaluations.Create and manage IT budgets, ensuring costeffective solutions.Evaluate and recommend technology investments to enhance efficiency and productivity.Collaborate with external vendors, negotiate contracts, and evaluate service levels.Liaise with business stakeholders to understand their technology needs and align IT services accordingly.Implement and enforce security policies, protocols, and best practices.Ensure compliance with industry standards (e.g., ISO, NIST) and regulatory requirements.Be available on 24/7 level to make sure business runs smoothly, without suspension.MDM Management
Implementation and ImprovementsEvaluate, Implement, and Improve applications based on the company needs*.
Application Support:Incident Handling and ResolutionUser Training and DocumentationApplication Implementation and Maintenance
SAP(ERP) Management:Customization and ConfigurationIntegration and UpgradesSAP Security and ComplianceEndUser Support
Stakeholder Collaboration:Work closely with business units to understand their application needs.Translate business requirements into technical specifications.Liaise with external vendors and internal IT teams.
Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation.Propose enhancements to existing applications and SAP systems.Stay informed about SAP updates and industry trends.
NOTE: This job description represents the essential functions of the position but is not all inclusive. Additional duties reasonably related to the position may be assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience. 5+ years of work experience as an IT Manager required. Professional Certifications desired. Proven experience leading and managing IT projects and rolling out IT infrastructures across various technologies. Excellent working knowledge of computer systems, security, network and systems administration, databases and data storage systems, and phone systems. Experience with VMware, Azure AD, Networking, Google Workspace, M365 Admin Center, Apple Business Manager required. Experience with Starship, SAP (FICO, MM, SD, CS) SAP Work Manager, RingCentral, Unifi products, Salesforce a plus.
SPECIAL JOB CHARACTERISTICS:Japanese speaker at a business level preferred.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.Experience with Accounting systems and accounting background a plus.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.Must be able to access and navigate each department at the organization's facilities.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS: To apply for this position, please visit Tadano Pan Americaâ€™s job board at https://tadanoamericas.com/uscan/en/about/careers/ RESUMES ACCEPTED UNTIL FILLED.
Tadano Pan America provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
